subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Arabic for English?
msgSnippet: Hi Charles, I would be interested in looking at the Arabic-for English system, purely because I like the look of Arabic. (I m not sure that the Read forum is
messageBody:
Hi Charles,

I would be interested in looking at the Arabic-for
English system, purely because I like the look of
Arabic. (I'm not sure that the Read forum is the best
place to upload these files though, so maybe you could
either mail them directly or suggest another
location).

I have a few arabic fonts on my system Andalus, Arabic
Transparent, Arial, Simplified Arabic, Simplified
Arabic Fixed, and Traditional Arabic.

Don't really understand how they work though - they
automatically write right to left and the characters
change depending on what is typed next to them, which
makes identifying a letter 'in context' difficult.

Though it would be interesting to try and work with an
Arabic transliteration of an English alphabet - a bit
like an Arabic version of Katakana - this wouldn't
really matter to me, as it's just the look of the
thing that I like.

In fact if I stuck at it I might be able to learn how
to identify the Arabic symbols that my keyboard is
typing, and then just type away in English without
having to resort to re-mappings, or worry that I'm
making intelligible sounds in Arabic.

To an Arabic speaker it would look pure garbage, but
then Read probably looks like that to the majority of
the rest of the world. So what if it looks good and
links up in attractive ways?

cheers,
Michael
